title: Salesforce Co-CEO Bret Taylor to Step Down; Marc Benioff to become the business-software company's sole chief executive
text:
Salesforce said Mr. Taylor would depart Jan. 31.

Salesforce elevated him to the co-CEO role a year ago as the company reported a lackluster sales outlook. He announced his departure as the company reported third-quarter revenue of $7.84 billion, slightly above analyst expectations. Profit was down to $210 million from $468 million a year earlier.

Mr. Taylor's departure marks another recent C-suite change for the San Francisco-based provider of cloud-based software. Gavin Patterson will also step down from his position as chief strategy officer, effective Jan. 31, according to a Nov. 23 filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

Write to Kathryn Hardison at kathryn.hardison@wsj.com

Salesforce Co-CEO Bret Taylor to Step Down
